intro: Terminalia sericea var. huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén terminalia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and alternate, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, three-lobed fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or secondary growth habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
